Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing on the CWL-4617 within 15 days with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617 the
recommendation will be treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a
provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Shay Mavis at (269) 243-2725
.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/26/25, a staff member was involved in two inappropriate
restraints incidents with two youth. The restraints were not per
technique.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed via telephone on 2/19/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and had no additional
information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported Staff 1 restrained him last week and made him bleed as
Staff 1 grabbed his wrist tightly and slid his hands up Youth A’s
arm. Youth A reported Staff 1 scratched him near the crease by
his elbow on his left arm and scratched his right wrist. Youth A
reported Staff 1 restrained him in his bedroom for two to three
minutes. Youth A reported Staff 2 observed the restraint. Youth A
reported he was restrained due to being unsafe, however was
unable to elaborate on what he was doing that was unsafe.
Youth A reported he was in the laundry room prior to the restraint
however he did not want to talk about it. Youth A reported he did
not recall if there was anyone else in the laundry room with him.
Youth A reported Staff 1 “tackled” Youth B to the ground and was
on top of Youth B. Youth A reported Youth B “shanked” Staff 1.
Youth A reported he could not remember who was present when
Staff 1 “tackled” Youth B but then stated “the whole house” was
there. Youth A reported Staff 1 has not worked at the facility since
the incident. Youth A reported Staff 1 was yelling however he
could not recall what Staff 1 was saying. Staff 1 left the house
after the incident and has not returned since the incident.
2

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported Youth A punched Staff 1 and Staff 1 placed Youth A in a
restraint in Youth A’s bedroom. Youth B reported he witnessed
Staff 1 place Youth A in a benevolent restraint. Youth B reported
Youth A was in a seated position during the restraint. Youth B
reported the restraint looked like normal restraints that are done at
the facility, and he had no concerns with what he witnessed.
Youth B did not witness Staff 1 take Youth A out of the laundry
room.
Youth B reported he and Youth D were picking on Youth C over
the weekend and Staff 1 told him to stop. Youth B reported he
continued to pick on Youth C. Youth B reported Staff 1 told him
that he had been letting him get away with a lot and Staff 1 was
“talking shit” however Youth B reported he could not recall exactly
what Staff 1 was saying. Youth B reported he told Staff 1 he was
going to “shank” him and went and got a metal piece from above
the windowsill which he had been sharpening. Youth B reported
Staff 1 came after him and “tackled” him into Youth C’s bedroom
on the bed. Youth B reported Staff 1 got off him and they both
walked back out to the living room. Youth B reported he
continued to pick on Youth C. Youth B reported Staff 1 “tackled”
him into the wall and held him against the wall, whispered to him
however Youth B did not recall what Staff 1 whispered, and Staff 1
pushed him to the ground. Youth B reported he was restrained by
Staff 2 due to attempting to hit Staff 1. Youth B reported once
released from the restraint he went AWOLP (Absent without Legal
Permission). Youth B reported Staff 2 and Staff 3, “chased” him
while he was AWOLP. Youth B reported he was going toward US
10 and Staff 3 “tackled” him to the ground. Youth B showed a
distance to indicate how far he was from US 10 when he was
“tackled”, and the distance was approximately twenty to twenty-
five yards. Youth B reported he was “escorted” back to the house
by Staff 2 and Staff 3. Youth B reported he had a bruise on his
right forearm from Staff 1 “tackling” him however he no longer has
the bruise.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported he did not see Youth A in the laundry room over the
weekend. Youth C reported Youth A was restrained in his
bedroom by Staff 1 as Youth A was hitting Staff 1. Youth C
reported he was standing outside Youth A’s bedroom and
witnessed Staff 1 restrain Youth A. Youth C reported Staff 1
3

“wrapped him up”. Youth C reported “wrapped him up” meaning a
normal restraint that is conducted at the facility. Youth C reported
Staff 1 released Youth A from the restraint and walked out of
Youth A’s bedroom and closed the bedroom door. Youth C
reported Youth A was in his bedroom alone and started screaming
and opened the door and had a cut on his wrist. Youth C reported
Youth A used an air freshener plug in’s metal part to cut his own
arm. Youth C reported he did not see any injury on Youth A when
Staff 1 exited the bedroom after the restraint. Youth C reported
Youth A self-inflicted the injury when he was in the bedroom by
himself after the restraint.
Youth C reported he was watching a movie on the iPad and Youth
B and Youth D were bothering him and trying to turn the iPad off.
Youth C reported Youth B was making fun of him. Staff 1 told
Youth B to stop picking on Youth C and to pick on him instead.
Youth C reported Staff 1 got between him and Youth B and was
swearing. Youth C reported Staff 1 “wrapped” Youth B up in a
restraint, but Youth B got out of the restraint. Youth C reported
Youth B started “swinging and spitting” on Staff 1 and said he was
going to “shank” Staff 1. Youth C reported Youth B went to the
vent and got a metal piece to “shank” Staff 1. Youth C jumped in
between Staff 1 and Youth B and Youth B pushed Youth C into
the wall causing his arm to hit the wall. Youth C reported Youth B
was “swinging” on Staff 1 and Staff 1 stated he “quit”. Youth C
reported Staff 1 pushed Youth B against the wall. Youth C
reported he never saw Youth B on the floor. Youth C reported no
other staff were present.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D
reported over the weekend Staff 1 picked Youth A up out of the
laundry room and carried him out. Youth D reported Staff 1
picked Youth A up by grabbing Youth A’s arms and “squeezing
really tight”. Youth D reported Youth A was hitting Staff 1 and Staff
1 restrained Youth A in his bedroom. Youth D reported he was
outside Youth A’s bedroom door and witnessed the restraint.
Youth D reported the restraint was “a proper restraint”. Youth D
reported Staff 1 released Youth A from the restraint and walked
out of the bedroom and closed Youth A’s bedroom door. Youth D
reported while Youth A’s bedroom door was closed, Youth A used
an air freshener metal plug piece to cut himself. Youth D reported
when he saw Staff 1 release Youth A from the restraint Youth A
was not bleeding but when Youth A opened the bedroom door
after Staff 1 left the bedroom and closed the door, Youth A was
bleeding near his wrist.
4

Youth D reported there was an incident the same day with Youth
B and Staff 1. Youth D reported he and Youth B were picking on
Youth C. Youth D reported Staff 1 told Youth B to stop picking on
Youth C and Staff 1 was swearing. Youth D reported Youth B
grabbed something near the vent in the house and “shanked” Staff
1. Staff 1 “grabbed” Youth B and ran Youth B into the wall. Still
holding Youth B, Staff 1 ran Youth B into Youth C’s bedroom.
Youth D reported Staff 1 was on top of Youth B in Youth C’s
bedroom on the bed holding Youth B’s wrist. Youth D reported
Staff 1 and Youth B came out of Youth C’s bedroom and Staff 1
ran Youth B into the wall a second time and put Youth B on the
ground on his back. Youth D reported “it was not a proper
restraint”. Youth D reported Staff 2 was present and put Youth B
in a proper benevolent restraint due to Youth B trying to punch
Staff 1. Youth D reported Staff 1 said he “quit” and waited for his
shift to end and left. Youth D reported Staff 1 has not been back
to the facility since the incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 2/19/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported the incident
with Youth A happened three weeks ago and he could not recall
everything that occurred. Staff 1 reported he recalled youth,
unable to recall which youth, sprayed water all over. Staff 1
reported he “pulled” Youth A up and “pulled” Youth A into his
room. Staff 1 reported he did not remember how he removed
Youth A from the laundry room and was unable to describe what
he meant by “pulled”. Staff 1 reported Youth A placed his bed to
block his bedroom door. Staff 1 reported he pushed Youth A’s
door open and went into Youth A’s bedroom and Youth A punched
him in the face. Staff 1 reported he attempted to place Youth A in
a restraint however was unable to get into the hold as Staff 1
reported he had a Carhartt coat on and was not able to maneuver
well. Staff 1 reported he released Youth A and left the bedroom.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was not injured at all. Staff 1 reported
Staff 2 witnessed the incident.
Staff 1 reported Youth B was “bullying” Youth C at the facility, and
he stepped in for Youth B to target his anger toward Staff 1 versus
Youth C. Staff 1 reported he and Youth B went back and forth
verbally however could not recall what was said. Staff 1 reported
Youth B left the living room and reached for something in the
hallway which was a sharpened piece of metal. Staff 1 reported
his first thought was to secure himself and others. Staff 1 reported
he did not recall what happened however he was able to recall he
got Youth B into the bedroom and saw that the item was metal.
5

Staff 1 reported Youth B was trying to “tackle” him. Staff 1
reported he did not recall what happened specifically and could
not provide any further details. Staff 1 reported Youth B was
attempting to go after him and attack him and at one point Youth B
“may have hit the wall”. Staff 1 reported he was trying to keep
himself safe and did “pin” Youth B to the ground as he was trying
to prevent Youth B from hitting him. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
stepped in at the end of the incident and placed Youth B in a
restraint. Staff 1 reported there was a lot going on. Staff 1
reported additional staff were called to the house. Staff 1 reported
additional staff, including Staff 3, arrived. Staff 1 reported he was
advised to go home for the day after the incident. Staff 1 reported
he did not complete an incident report as he was placed on
administrative leave and advised not to come into the facility. Staff
1 reported he was holding Youth B’s hands/wrists when he had
Youth B on the bed however was unable to explain how he was
positioned as he stated he “could not explain”.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 2/19/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported the day of
the incidents was the first shift he had worked with Staff 1. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 was acting “nervous and uptight” during the shift.
Staff 2 reported Youth A was in the laundry room sitting in the
corner. Staff 1 went into the laundry room, grabbed Youth A and
picked him up and forced Youth A out of the laundry room. Staff 1
went into the laundry room, grabbed Youth A, picked him up, and
forced him out of the laundry room. Staff 2 described Staff 1
grabbed Youth A under the arms and carried Youth A out of the
laundry room. Staff 2 reported the way Staff 1 took Youth A out of
the laundry room was not a trained technique that is taught at the
facility. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 took Youth A to his bedroom and
Youth A punched Staff 1 in the face while in his bedroom. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 attempted to place Youth A in a restraint however
Staff 1 was unable to as he was wearing a coat. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 released the restraint as he was unable to get Youth A in
the hold. Staff 2 reported he never saw Staff 1 hurt Youth A. Staff
2 reported Youth A had two scrapes that Youth A was stating
occurred during the restraint however Staff 2 reported he saw the
air freshener on the floor in Youth A’s bedroom and the metal
prongs on the air freshener fit the injury perfectly. Staff 2 reported
he believes Youth A caused the injuries to himself with the air
freshener.
Staff 2 reported he was standing outside Youth A’s bedroom door
and Youth C came down the hall with a radio and called for
additional staff assistance. Staff 2 reported he heard Staff 1
6

yelling and Staff 1 came down the hall with Youth B. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 took Youth B into the bedroom and had Youth B
“pinned” on the bed and was holding Youth B’s wrist for fifteen to
twenty seconds. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was saying “he tried to
stab me”. Staff 2 reported he noticed a metal piece laying on the
floor and he picked it up and put it in his pocket. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 released Youth B from the bed and Staff 1 and Youth B
returned to the living room. Staff 2 reported he went back to
check on Youth A. Staff 2 reported he then went into the living
room where Staff 1 and Youth B were continuing to argue back
and forth. Staff 2 reported he was attempting to get the other
youth out of the living room area when Staff 1 “charged” toward
Youth B. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 grabbed Youth B’s shirt and ran
Youth B into the wall, Staff 1 “slammed” Youth B on the wall and
“threw” Youth B onto the ground where Staff 1 “pinned” Youth B
down on the ground for fifteen to twenty seconds. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 had Youth B pinned to the ground as Staff 1 was holding
Youth B’s wrists and Staff 1 had his weight on Youth B. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 got off Youth B and called someone, unknown
who, and stated “I quit”. Staff 2 reported Youth B went to hit Staff
1. Staff 2 reported he placed Youth B in a benevolent restraint.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 left the house and Youth B calmed down
quickly at which time Staff 2 released Youth B from the restraint.
Staff 2 reported Youth B then went AWOLP from the house. Staff
2 reported additional staff, unable to recall who, responded to the
house. Staff 2 reported he and another staff unable to recall who,
went to follow Youth B. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 came to assist
with Youth B. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 did not restrain Youth B.
Staff 2 reported Youth B returned to the house. Staff 2 reported
once Youth B was back at the house, Youth B stated Staff 3
knocked him to the ground however Staff 2 reported he did not
see that occur.
It should be noted, Staff 2 is a new staff that had only worked at
the facility about a month when the incident occurred, and it was
his first time working with Staff 1. The incident happened quickly
and Staff 2 was trying to keep the other youth back from all the
incidents.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 2/19/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he was not
present in the house during the incidents between Staff 1, Youth
A, and Youth B. Staff 3 went to assist in locating Youth B after
Youth B went AWOLP from the house. Staff 3 reported he went
driving down the road toward US 10 looking for Youth B. Staff 3
7

reported Youth B was walking halfway in the road. Staff 3 pulled
the vehicle over in front of Youth B and asked Youth B to stop
walking in the road. Staff 3 reported Youth B started to run at him
and was swearing. Staff 3 reported he attempted to use proximity
control, as Staff 3 was using his arms out and positioned himself
in front of Youth B in order to get Youth B off the road. Staff 3
reported Youth B was pushing against him and Youth B’s force
caused Staff 3 to fall back as the ground was ice. Staff 3 reported
Youth B was pushing against him and Youth B’s force caused
Staff 3 to fall back as the ground was icy. Staff 3 reported both he
and Youth B fell to the ground. Staff 3 reported he never
attempted to restrain Youth B. Staff 3 reported after he and Youth
B fell on the ice, Youth B got up and agreed to walk back to the
house. Staff 3 reported other staff came to assist however he did
not recall who.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 1/26/2025 in the laundry room and hallway of
the house was reviewed on 1/29/2025. Youth A was in the
laundry room however it is unclear what Youth A was doing as he
was not able to be fully viewed based on his location and the
video camera angle. Staff 1 walked into the laundry room over to
where Youth A was. Staff 1 bent down and stood up with Youth A
in his arms. Staff 1 was holding Youth A with his arms under
Youth A’s armpits. Staff 1 walked out of the laundry room with
Youth A in his arms. Staff 1 exited the laundry room with Youth A
into the hallway. Youth A’s feet were on the ground and Staff 1
had a hold of Youth A and walked Youth A to his bedroom. It is
unclear exactly how Staff 1 is holding Youth A as he walked Youth
A to his bedroom as Staff 1 was wearing a large jacket and Youth
A was in front of Staff 1 resulting in Staff 1’s arm/hand placement
not being able to be viewed.
Video footage of 1/26/2025 in the commons area and hallway
was reviewed on 1/29/2025. Youth B walked out of the common
area into the hallway and reached above the windowsill to get an
object. Youth B began to walk toward Staff 1. Staff 1 secured
Youth B’s wrist area and walked toward Youth B quickly resulting
in Youth B walking backwards into the hallway quickly. Staff 1
had his hands around Youth B’s wrist area as he pushed Youth B
backwards into the bedroom. I am not sure this paints a picture of
what occurred. There is no video camera in the bedroom, so it is
unable to be viewed what occurred in the bedroom. Staff 2
approached the bedroom door as well as Youth C, Youth D, and
Youth A. Staff 2 entered the bedroom. Staff 2 exits the bedroom
and Youth B and Staff 1 follow. Staff 2 motioned for Youth A,
8

Youth C, and Youth D to go down the hallway away from the door
and Staff 2 follows Youth A, Youth C, and Youth D.
Youth B and Staff 1 go back into the common area. Staff 1 walked
in front of Youth B and appeared to be talking to Youth B however
the video does not have audio. Staff 1 began walking next to
Youth B and bumps his body into Youth B. Staff 1 and Youth B
appear to be talking as Staff 1 puts his arms out to the side. Staff
2 walked into the common area with Youth A, Youth C, and Youth
D. Staff 1 walked toward the couches and Youth B moved toward
Staff 1. Staff 1 turned around and was standing face to face with
Youth B and was holding his left arm up in the air and appeared to
be talking to his watch as he fidgeted with something on his wrist.
Staff 1 placed his right hand on Youth B’s arm above the elbow
and his left hand on Youth B’s other arm. Staff 1 pushed Youth B
backwards. Youth B’s arms flew forward. Youth C attempted to
stand off to the side between Staff 1 and Youth B. Staff 1
appeared to talk into his watch. Staff 2 steps in and can be seen
pointing toward the hallway. Staff 2 gently placed an open hand
on Youth B’s stomach and appeared to be attempting to get Youth
B to move from the area. Youth B stepped closer toward Staff 1.
Staff 1 stood in place and put his right hand on Youth B’s forearm
area and left hand around Youth B’s bicep area. Staff 1 pushed
Youth B back again and was viewed to have a hold of Youth B’s
body as he quickly moved Youth B backwards through the
common area. Staff 1 had his left arm around Youth B’s front of
his stomach holding Youth B’s left arm and his right arm around
Youth B’s left arm. Staff 1 ran Youth B into the wall. Staff 1
appeared to use his body weight to turn Youth B making Youth B
fall to the floor with Staff 1 on top of Youth B. Due to the angle it is
difficult to see what is occurring as Staff 1 is on top of Youth B on
the floor and both appear to be struggling. Staff 2 moved to get
Youth A, Youth C, and Youth D away from the situation. It is
unclear exactly what occurred on the floor however Youth A can
be viewed laying in a supine position with Staff 1 over top of him.
Staff 1 appeared to have Youth B’s right arm secured using his leg
to pin Youth B’s arm down and Staff 1 had ahold of Youth B’s left
arm with his hands. Staff 1 moved his leg and secured Youth B’s
right wrist with his hand. Staff 1 got up and Staff 2 walked over
closer. Youth B got up however due to the wall angle it is unclear
what occurred. Youth B can be viewed standing and Staff 2
moved toward Youth B. Youth B quickly moved backward as Staff
1 was in front of him and arms are moving however it is unclear
what occurred and Staff 2 placed Youth B in a benevolent
restraint. Staff 1 remained in front of Youth B for a few seconds
however it is unclear if Youth B was holding on to Staff 1 or vise
9

versa. Staff 1 walked over, got his coat, took his cellphone out,
and paced in the common area.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 206180241 dated 1/26/2025 for Youth A:
Staff 2 observed Staff 1 place Youth A in a benevolent
restraint. Staff 1 entered Youth A's bedroom and Youth A
struck Staff 1 on the face with a closed fist. Staff 1 opened
the door and entered the bedroom. The door slammed
behind Staff 1. Staff 2 opened the door and observed Staff
1 initiating a benevolent restraint. Staff 1 had difficulty
placing Youth A in the restraint due to Staff 1’s winter
clothing. The restraint was held from 11:52 to 11:55am.
Youth A calmed down quickly and was released.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 206190240 for Youth B dated 1/26/2025:
After an incident with a staff member, Youth B jumped up
and followed the staff out of the room. Another argument
ensued. Youth B drew back his right arm with a closed fist.
Staff 2 initiated a benevolent restraint.
• Eagle Village Incident Report dated 1/26/2025 authored by
Staff 2: Staff 2 heard Staff 1 verbally arguing with Youth B
in the front room. There was yelling back and forth
between Staff 1 and Youth B. Staff 2 observed Staff 1
struggling with Youth B. Staff 1 had ahold of Youth B’s
shirt with both hands and was pushing him backwards.
Staff 1 drove Youth B into another youth’s bedroom. Staff
2 arrived at the doorway and Staff 1 had Youth B pinned
down onto the bed holding onto both of Youth B’s wrists.
Staff 1 stated Youth B tried to stab him and motioned to a
piece of metal lying on the bedroom floor. Staff 2 picked up
the metal. Staff 1 released Youth B after a couple minutes
and immediately left the room. Youth B jumped up and
followed Staff 1 out of the room. Another argument
ensured in the room. Staff 2 arrived, and Staff 1 and Youth
B were cursing at each other and Staff 1 was calling Youth
B “gay”. This enraged Youth B and Youth B began to
physically fight Staff 1. Staff 1 grabbed Youth B under the
arms and charged forward with him, slamming Youth B into
the corner outside the therapist’s office door. Staff 1 then
threw Youth B to the floor. Youth B was on his back and
Staff 1 had Youth B pinned down by the wrists. Staff 1
10

released Youth B after a few seconds. Youth B got up and
almost immediately squared up to Staff 1. Youth B drew
back his right arm with a closed fist. Staff 2 placed Youth B
in a benevolent restraint.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Therapeutic Holds: The only approved
therapeutic hold techniques are the methods and techniques
taught in the required Aegis course and should only be used
when a resident is a serious threat of safety or violence to
self or others and/or after all verbal de-escalation and
behavior support techniques have been exhausted. Anytime
staff initiate a physical intervention it is essential for staff to
maintain a calm and even demeanor to help the youth lower
the intensity of the emotions they are experiencing.
Remember the actions and attitudes of staff influence the
actions and attitudes of youth.
• The Aegis System Model: Voluntary Escort: Staff hold client
arm above elbow (bicep area), Level One-extended Arm
Hold: staffs outside arm grabs wrist above hand, place the
palm “away”. Level Two- extended arm hold: staff hook, arm
in closed position , Level Three- full closed arm hold: from
second level, staff’s outside arm hooks around the front of
client forearm and places palm against back of youth while
maintaining grip with the inner hand, Aegis Safety Position:
this is a two to one position with two staff on either side of
the youth in a seated position.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had disciplinary action dated
12/31/2024 for not completing an incident report prior to
leaving shift. Staff 1 completed Aegis training on 7/12/2024.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 had no discipline in his
personnel file and completed Aegis training on 1/10/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per video footage
reviewed and interviews, Staff 1 went into the laundry room and
removed Youth A from the laundry room by placing his arms
under Youth A’s armpits and carrying Youth A out which is not an
Aegis technique.
Staff 1 also went hands on with Youth B twice not utilizing Aegis
trained techniques as Staff 1 moved quickly toward Youth B and
moved Youth B into the bedroom where Staff 1 pinned Youth B
down by securing his wrists on the bed. The second incident
involved Staff 1 pushing Youth B backwards and running Youth B
11

into the wall and Staff 1 maneuvered Youth B to the ground where
Staff 1 was on top of Youth B and pinned Youth B’s arms down.
Youth B alleged Staff 3 “tackled” him to the ground after Youth B
went AWOLP however there is not enough to support the
allegation as no other staff witnessed this occurring and Staff 3
denied “tackling” or restraining Youth B. Staff 3 reported Youth B
moved toward him with his body and both Staff 3 and Youth B fell
due to the ground being icy.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/26/25, a staff member pushed a youth into their bedroom
and pushed another youth down the hallway.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed via telephone on 2/19/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and had no additional
information.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported Staff 1 “tackled” him into the wall and held him against
the wall, and pushed him to the ground. Youth B reported Staff 1
pushed him during the incidents however he did not recall how
many times Staff 1 pushed him.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported Staff 1 pushed Youth B against the wall.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D
reported Staff 1 pushed Youth B approximately three times during
